actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Appropriations.
Reported to House from the Committee on Appropriations, H. Rept. 95-1236.
Measure called up by unanimous consent in House.
Referred to Senate Committee on Appropriations.
Reported to Senate from the Committee on Appropriations with amendment, S. Rept. 95-937.
House agreed to certain Senate amendments.
House agreed to certain Senate amendments with an amendment.
Senate agreed to certain House amendment.

official_title: Joint resolution making an urgent appropriation for the black lung program of the Department of Labor, and for other purposes, for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1978.

summary.as: House agreed to Senate amendment with amendment
summary.text: (House agreed to certain Senate amendments with an amendment) Appropriates $181,689,000 to the Department of Labor, Employment Standards Administration, for payments from the Black Lung Disability Trust Fund. Makes certain funds already appropriated to the Department of Labor for other purposes available for such payments but requires the Fund to reimburse the Department. Appropriates $43,500,000 to the Railroad Retirement Board Regional Rail Transportation Protective Account for benefit payments. Appropriates $25,000,000 to the Department of Health, Education, and Welfare (Education Division) for special projects under the Emergency School Aid Act. Extends the application deadline for such project funds to August 1, 1978, for any district where changed circumstances precluded conformity with regular application cycle. Appropriates $3,788,000 to the Department of Commerce for administrative expenses of the Local Public Works of the Economic Development Administration.

titles.title: A resolution making an urgent supplemental appropriation for the black lung program of the Department of Labor for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1978.
Joint resolution making an urgent appropriation for the black lung program of the Department of Labor, and for other purposes, for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1978.
